customer_addr:
S 4524 Fox Ridge Rd
Hillsboro, WI 54634

citations.narrative:
In the southwest corner in the outdoor sheltered area; storage of things such as lumber and buckets is next to a run that
houses two dogs. The area isn't where dogs can contact but, the stored lumber and buckets next to the dogs has a build-
up of soiled shavings and dust and the manner of storage would make it difficult to clean out the old shavings from this
area, creating risks for germs or areas for pests to live in. Ensure that storage of items in animal areas is limited to
materials necessary for proper husbandry practices and that the storage does not interfere with normal husbandry
practices such as cleaning floor areas next to dogs.

A litter of puppies was observed for about 5 minutes on a raised run that has a part solid floor area and part mesh. One
smaller puppy in the litter was observed to have a foot sometimes pass through when going over to the mesh floor. The
larger puppies in the litter were observed to not have any feet pass through the mesh. Ensure that puppies are housed on
a floor that does not allow their feet to pass through any openings. (The facility had a completely solid floor enclosure
available during inspection to move the affected puppy w/ litter mates to).

Records indicate the facility has an Attending Veterinarian and is up to date on physical exams and rabies vaccinations
for the adult dogs, however the licensee didn't have a written program of veterinary care (PVC) that was available for
inspection. A written PVC is required and helps ensure that a plan for adequate veterinary care and husbandry guidance
is in place for the animals. Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian to obtain a written and signed PVC and maintain it
available for inspection at the facility.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by April 12, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.1(b) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
In the southwest corner in the outdoor sheltered area; storage of things such as lumber and buckets is next to a run that 
houses two dogs. The area isn't where dogs can contact but, the stored lumber and buckets next to the dogs has a build-
up of soiled shavings and dust and the manner of storage would make it difficult to clean out the old shavings from this 
area, creating risks for germs or areas for pests to live in. Ensure that storage of items in animal areas is limited to 
materials necessary for proper husbandry practices and that the storage does not interfere with normal husbandry 
practices such as cleaning floor areas next to dogs. 
3.6(a)(2)(x) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
A litter of puppies was observed for about 5 minutes on a raised run that has a part solid floor area and part mesh. One 
smaller puppy in the litter was observed to have a foot sometimes pass through when going over to the mesh floor. The 
larger puppies in the litter were observed to not have any feet pass through the mesh. Ensure that puppies are housed on 
a floor that does not allow their feet to pass through any openings. (The facility had a completely solid floor enclosure 
available during inspection to move the affected puppy w/ litter mates to). 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Records indicate the facility has an Attending Veterinarian and is up to date on physical exams and rabies vaccinations 
for the adult dogs, however the licensee didn't have a written program of veterinary care (PVC) that was available for 
inspection. A written PVC is required and helps ensure that a plan for adequate veterinary care and husbandry guidance 
is in place for the animals. Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian to obtain a written and signed PVC and maintain it 
available for inspection at the facility. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by April 12, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee

and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
